meanings.definition: A graphic record of the variations in the size of an organ or body part
meanings.sent1: The doctor showed me the plethysmogram of my heart to explain its size changes.
meanings.sent2: The plethysmogram displayed the fluctuations in the size of the patient's lungs.
meanings.sent3: I never thought a plethysmogram of a kidney could look so interesting!
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a plethysmogram, constantly fluctuating in intensity.
meanings.sent5: The plethysmogram of the tree rings vividly showed its growth over the years.

meanings.definition: The measurement of changes in volume in a particular part of the body, typically used in medical monitoring.
meanings.sent1: The nurse used a plethysmogram to track the swelling in the patient's ankle.
meanings.sent2: Doctors rely on the plethysmogram to monitor changes in blood flow.
meanings.sent3: The plethysmogram of the ice cream tub showed how much had been eaten.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a plethysmogram of joy.
meanings.sent5: The plethysmogram of the balloon expanding illustrated the concept perfectly.
